document.heading: Advisory Neighborhood Commission Vacancy Amendment Act of 1993

history.narrative: Law 10-18, the “Advisory Neighborhood Commission Vacancy Amendment Act of 1993,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-76, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 1, 1993, and June 29, 1993, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 16, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 10-50 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-18 became effective on September 30, 1993.
